In Julia, Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

Here is the Julia code to solve this problem:

```julia
function add_yearmonth(df)
    df[:ym] = map(x -> Dates.year(x)*100 + Dates.month(x), df.dt)
    return df
end
```
This function `add_yearmonth` takes a DataFrame as argument and adds a new column `ym`. The new column contains the year and month of the date in "yyyymm" format. It uses the map function to apply this transformation to each element of the `dt` column. Here, we use the `Dates.year` and `Dates.month` functions from the DataFramesMeta package to extract the year and month from a DateTime object respectively.
